intro: Bassovia hebepoda, commonly known as the smoothleaf bassovia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
